title: How much approximately does the UK government pay a college to educate a 16 year old, per year? - Quora

response.answer_text: All 16 and 17 year old full time students are funded at the same national funding rate per student, per year. The national funding rate for 2017 to 2018 for students studying full time and part time is set out in the table below. National funding rate per student 540+ hours 16 and 17 year olds, students aged 18 and over with high needs £4,000 450+ hours Students aged 18 and over who are not high needs £3,300 450 to 539 hours 16 and 17 year olds, students aged 18 and over with high needs £3,300 360 to 449 hours £2,700 280 to 359 hours £2,133 Up to 279 hours £4,000 per full time equivalent (FTE*) (FTE*) means the proportion of 600 hours.
